title: Avoid long literals lacking separators
description: Consider using underscores to improve readability of large numeric literals.

title: Use underscores in numeric literals for readability
description: Consider using underscores to improve readability of large numeric literals.

suggestions.suggestion: let nps = (nodes as f64 / (total_time_ms as f64 / 1000.0)) as u64;
suggestions.replacement: let nps = (nodes as f64 / (total_time_ms as f64 / 1000.0)) as u64;

title: Use direct variable access in format strings
description: Consider using direct variable access in `format!` string for better readability and performance.

title: Prefer `!is_empty` over length comparison to zero
description: Using `!is_empty` is clearer and more explicit than comparing the length of a collection to zero.

title: Use references in loop over containers for better performance
description: Using references in loops can improve performance by avoiding unnecessary cloning of elements.

title: Avoid unnecessary string allocations in hot paths
description: Hardcoded string literals can lead to unnecessary memory allocations, especially in hot paths. Replacing them with static references can improve performance by avoiding heap allocations.
lint_message: Unreadable literal in bishop attack tables
suggested_fix: Replace hardcoded strings with static references to avoid allocations.
reasoning: Reduces both memory usage and improves the runtime performance of the application.

title: Avoid unreadable literals in tables
description: Unreadable literals can make the code hard to understand and maintain. This lint helps identify and suggest improvements for better readability.
suggested_fix: Use meaningful variable names or comments to clarify the purpose of the literal.
reasoning: Improving readability makes it easier for other developers to understand the code, reducing cognitive load and potential bugs.
